title: Fix focus lost to only affect the kitty that lost focus
description:
When focus is lost, the current implementation iterates through ALL kitty windows to decrease font size. This is incorrect - we should only affect the kitty that just lost focus.

Current buggy behavior:
- Focus lost event triggers
- Code iterates through ALL kitty windows
- Decreases font size in ALL kitty instances

Required fix:
- Track which kitty currently has focus when focus is gained
- On focus lost, only affect the kitty that just lost focus
- Clear the focus tracker after handling

title: Enhance zooming status JSON output with structured data
description:
Add detailed zooming status to focus event JSON output.

Currently, when kitty focus changes, we only emit basic events. We need to add structured data about font adjustment operations.

## Requirements

### Focus Gained Event
Add `zooming` field with structured status:
- `status`: "success" | "not_configured" | "connection_failed" | "auth_failed"
- `pid`: kitty process ID
- `font_adjustment`: "+3" (always)
- When successful: include adjustment details
- When failed: include error reason

Example:
```json
{
  "event": "focus_gained",
  "window_id": 12345,
  "app_id": "kitty",
  "zooming": {
    "status": "success",
    "pid": 45678,
    "font_adjustment": "+3"
  }
}
```

### Focus Lost Event
Add `zooming` field for single kitty:
- `status`: "success" | "failed"
- `pid`: kitty process ID (the one that lost focus)
- `font_adjustment`: "-3" (always)
- When failed: include error

Example:
```json
{
  "event": "focus_lost",
  "zooming": {
    "status": "success",
    "pid": 45678,
    "font_adjustment": "-3"
  }
}
```

## Notes
- Focus lost should only affect ONE kitty at a time (the one that just lost focus)
- Not all kitty instances have remote control configured
- No message field needed - use structured data only
- Status values should be machine-readable
